titleInfo.title: WAS brought to the City Police Jail.

mods.abstract: WAS brought to the City Police Jail on the 30th of August, 1860, the dark griff girl URANIE alias LUCINDA LEWIS. Says she was raised by Mrs. Man-passant and afterwards bought by Mr. Victor Pepin, then sold to a negro trader by the name of White, then to Mr. Miller, free man of color; by Mr. Miller to Col. Bingaman, who was then living in Natchez, Miss., and finally sold by the latter to Mr. John Lewis, who left for California about twelve years ago. She never heard anything of him since, and consequently always supposed herself to be free. She is 5 feet 6 inches high, has a thin and agreeable face, and is aged about 35 years. The owner will call and claim his property according to law. MIGUEL HERNANDEZ, JR., Keeper of City Police Jail. Registered September 3, 1860. ALFRED A. DUCROS, Clerk of Comptroller. se4 15t

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
